Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PhD2 (PhD-2, P. hamadryas alpha-defensin; UCSS1a; natural AMPs; monkey, primates, mammals,  animals; 3S=S)

Literature Information.Literature: Active against the Gram-  bacterium E. coli (MIC 1.7 uM), and the Gram+ bacteria L. monocytogenes (MIC 2.1 uM), S. aureus (MIC 7.8 uM), and fungus C. albicans (MIC 4.0 uM). 100 mM NaCl had only a small effect on activity against other microorgamisms but caused a large drop in activity against S. aureus (MIC >50 uM). Updated 7/2021; 6/2022
Literature Information.Author: Tsvetkova EV, Aleshina GM, Shamova OV, Leonova LE, Lehrer RI, Kokryakov VN.2006
Literature Information.Title: alpha-Defensins from blood leukocytes of the monkey Papio hamadryas
